intro: Aglaia argentea var. hypoleuca, commonly known as white aglaia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Meliaceae family, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds, and it is often found in lowland rainforests. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
